sentences.en: A hyperactive deep tendon reflex was noted, but there was neither muscle weakness nor hepatomegaly.
sentences.cn: 深部肌腱反射过强, 无肌肉衰弱或肝肿大.

sentences.en: Alarm will affect the person's mood, make person waking after hyperactive spirit.
sentences.cn: 闹铃还会影响到人的情绪, 使人惊醒后精神亢奋.

sentences.en: B is hyperactive, and B is quiet.
sentences.cn: 是极度活跃的也是安静的.

sentences.en: Ever since, South Korea's hyperactive blogosphere has been churning out conspiracy theories by the dozen.
sentences.cn: 从这以后, 韩国活跃的博客圈就开始炮制那些阴谋理论.

sentences.en: Fiery guitar - work embellishes the already hyperactive music, injecting ardent fury and cosmic demeanor.
sentences.cn: 热烈亢奋的吉他配乐修饰着本已异常亢奋的乐曲, 注入了燃烧般的狂热及大气.

sentences.en: Having a large account is a great advantage, but whatever your size, do not be hyperactive.
sentences.cn: 资金多是个很大的优势, 但无论你的仓位多大, 不要过分交易.

sentences.en: He was a slow developer and hyperactive.
sentences.cn: 他发育很慢并患有多动症.

sentences.en: His mind was hyperactive, turning over possibilities, sketching sceneries.
sentences.cn: 他的思想异常活跃.他反复推测各种可能, 描绘各种前景.

sentences.en: His research was used in planning treatments for hyperactive children.
sentences.cn: 他的研究被用来为多动的儿童设计治疗方案。

sentences.en: If he's the calm type, he'll become more hyperactive around you.
sentences.cn: 如果他本身是很冷静的类型, 在你身边他会变得很活跃.

sentences.en: Most children can be inattentive , hyperactive, or impulsive at times.
sentences.cn: 多数的孩子有时候可能会不专心 、 过动或冲动.

sentences.en: Most of those riches go to vendors and brokers who benefit from hyperactive trading.
sentences.cn: 很多生意人和经纪商从这种超级活跃的交易中致富.

sentences.en: So, what is globality? It is the 24 - hour interconnected, hyperactive, sleep - deprived, e - mail - fueled world.
sentences.cn: 那末, 什么是全球性 呢 ?它是24小时的相互联系的 、 极度活跃的 、 失去睡眠的 、 以 电子邮件 为燃料的世界.

sentences.en: The scatty, glancing quality of a hyperactive but unfocused intelligence ( London Review of Books ).
sentences.cn: 极度活跃但无聚焦点的思想 ( 伦敦图书评论 ).

sentences.en: The smaller animals like dogs, cats , etc , which are restless hyperactive, breath fast and die fast.
sentences.cn: 一些小动物,好比狗, 猫等总是躁动不安, 呼吸快而急促,生命就会很短暂.

trans.tran_cn: 活动过度的，极度活跃的
trans.tran_en: someone, especially a child, who is hyperactive is too active, and is not able to keep still or be quiet for very long
